s: Tyson they have all of Canadian music personified. The legendary Sylvia, continuing to diversify an eminent career in middle age, does not dominate these proceedings (though well she might). Her solo standouts are "Denim blue eyes" and the catchy (and very Canadian) "Pepère's mill," the latter reprised from her 1989 Stony Plain solo CD ...
